subject: Photography
title: Ethics of Photographing Strangers
description: One-minute skill: Ethics of Photographing Strangers.

hook.text: You see a perfect moment ‚Äî but the subject hasn't consented. Is it ethical to press the shutter?

buildup.text: In most countries, photographing people in public spaces is legal. But legal and ethical aren't the same thing.

discovery.text: Many photographers follow an unwritten code: don't mock, don't exploit, don't photograph vulnerability for spectacle.

twist.text: Some subjects object to being photographed. Others are delighted. You can't always predict the reaction.

climax.text: The ethical street photographer asks: does this image respect the subject's dignity? If not, it's not worth taking.

punchline.text: Legal is the minimum. Ethical is the standard.

quiz.question: What ethical guideline do many street photographers follow?
options: Don't exploit or mock subjects ‚Äî respect their dignity
Never photograph anyone without written consent
Only photograph people who are smiling
